line: I NTRODUCTION
label: paragraph

line: This document is not a contract of insurance but summarises the
label: paragraph

line: benefits provided to you by virtue of your holding an Ulster Bank
label: paragraph

line: Black MasterCard. The provision of those benefits is enabled by an
label: paragraph

line: insurance policy held by and issued to Ulster Bank by Inter Partner
label: paragraph

line: Assistance (policy number XXXX).
label: paragraph

line: U lster Bank is the only policyholder under the insurance policy and
label: paragraph

line: only it has direct rights under the policy against the insurer. This
label: paragraph

line: agreement does not give you direct rights under the policy of
label: paragraph

line: insurance. Strict compliance with the terms and conditions of this
label: paragraph

line: agreement is required if you are to receive its benefit.
label: paragraph

line: E LIGIBILITY
label: paragraph

line: The benefits summarised in this document are dependent upon you
label: paragraph

line: being a valid Ulster Bank Black MasterCard Cardholder at the time
label: paragraph

line: of any incident giving rise to a claim. Ulster Bank will give you notice
label: paragraph

line: if there are any material changes to these terms and conditions or if
label: paragraph

line: the policy supporting the benefits available under this agreement is
label: paragraph

line: cancelled or expires without renewal on equivalent terms.
label: paragraph

line: T his is your benefit guide and agreement with us. It contains details
label: paragraph

line: of benefits, conditions and exclusions relating to Ulster Bank Black
label: paragraph

line: MasterCard Cardholders and is the basis on which all claims you
label: paragraph

line: make will be settled.
label: paragraph

line: IMPORTANT INFORMATION
label: heading

line: Claims arising directly or indirectly from any pre-existing
label: paragraph

line: medical conditions are not covered.
label: paragraph

line: The benefits will not cover you when you are travelling against
label: paragraph

line: the advice of a medical practitioner (or would be travelling
label: paragraph

line: against the advice of a medical practitioner had you sought
label: paragraph

line: his/her advice);
label: paragraph

line: The benefits will not cover you when you are travelling with the
label: paragraph

line: intention of obtaining medical treatment or consultation abroad;
label: paragraph

line: The benefits will not cover you if you have any undiagnosed
label: paragraph

line: symptoms that require attention or investigation in the future (that
label: paragraph

line: is symptoms for which you are awaiting investigations or
label: paragraph

line: consultations, or awaiting results of investigations, where the
label: paragraph

line: underlying cause has not been established).
label: paragraph

line: If injury, illness loss, theft or damage happens you should
label: paragraph

line: immediately call AXA Assistance on +XXXX to report a medical
label: paragraph

line: emergency, request repatriation, report any loss, theft or
label: paragraph

line: damage.
label: paragraph

line: In the event of curtailment necessitating your early return home
label: paragraph

line: you must contact AXA Assistance. The service is available to
label: paragraph

line: you and operates 24 hours a day, 365 days a year for advice
label: paragraph

line: and assistance with your return home. AXA Assistance will
label: paragraph

line: arrange transport home when you have notice of serious illness,
label: paragraph

line: imminent demise, or death of a close relative at home.
label: paragraph

line: In order to be eligible to receive benefits under this Benefit
label: paragraph

line: Schedule for Sections B - M, you must charge 100% of the total
label: paragraph

line: cost of pre-booked transport and/or accommodation to your
label: paragraph

line: covered card, provided this is booked a minimum of 2 nights in
label: paragraph

line: advance.
label: paragraph

line: In order to be eligible to receive benefits under this benefit
label: paragraph

line: schedule for Sections N, P – S, you will only be covered if 100%
label: paragraph

line: of the total cost has been charged to the covered card:
label: paragraph

line: Section N – Rental Car Collision Damage Waiver – cover for
label: paragraph

line: vehicles hired with the covered card;
label: paragraph

line: Section P – Ticket Cancellation – cover for event ticket(s)
label: paragraph

line: purchased with the covered card;
label: paragraph

line: Section Q – Theft of Handbag and/or Wallet in Explainable
label: paragraph

line: Circumstances – cover for handbag/wallet purchased with the
label: paragraph

line: covered card;
label: paragraph

line: Section R – ATM Assault – for cash taken from the ATM machine
label: paragraph

line: with the covered card, and
label: paragraph

line: Section S – Extended Warranty – cover for eligible items
label: paragraph

line: purchased with the covered card.
label: paragraph

line: These benefits will be governed by the law of England and Wales
label: paragraph

line: unless we have specifically agreed in writing otherwise.

label: paragraph

label: paragraph

label: paragraph

label: paragraph

label: paragraph

line: You are covered worldwide for trips of 60 consecutive days. The
label: paragraph

line: cover is limited to a total of 183 days in any 12 month period.
label: paragraph

label: paragraph

line: solely within the country of residence is only covered where
label: paragraph

line: you have pre - booked at least two nights’ accommodation in a
label: paragraph

line: hotel, motel, holiday camp, bed and breakfast, holiday cottage or
label: paragraph

line: similar accommodation rented for a fee.

line: EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE
label: heading

line: Contact AXA Assistance on Telephone: +XXXXX
label: paragraph

line: I n the event of a serious illness or accident which may lead to in-
label: paragraph

line: patient hospital treatment, or before any arrangements are made for
label: paragraph

line: repatriation or in the event of curtailment necessitating your early
label: paragraph

line: return home or in the event of an emergency you must contact AXA
label: paragraph

line: Assistance (any minor illness or injury costs must be paid for by you
label: paragraph

line: and reclaimed). The service is available to you and operates 24
label: paragraph

line: hours a day, 365 days a year for advice, assistance, making
label: paragraph

line: arrangements for hospital admission, repatriation and authorisation
label: paragraph

line: of medical expenses. If this is not possible because the condition
label: paragraph

line: requires immediate emergency treatment you must contact AXA
label: paragraph

line: Assistance as soon as possible. Private medical treatment is not
label: paragraph

line: covered unless authorised specifically by AXA Assistance.
label: paragraph

line: M edical Assistance Abroad
label: paragraph

line: AXA Assistance has the medical expertise, contacts and facilities to
label: paragraph

line: help should you be injured in an accident or fall ill. AXA Assistance
label: paragraph

line: will also arrange transport home when this is considered to be
label: paragraph

line: medically necessary, or when you have notice of serious illness or
label: paragraph

line: death of a close relative at home.
label: paragraph

line: P ayment for Medical Treatment Abroad
label: paragraph

line: If you are admitted to a hospital/clinic while outside the country of
label: paragraph

line: residence, AXA Assistance will arrange for medical expenses
label: paragraph

line: covered by the policy to be paid direct to the hospital/clinic. To take
label: paragraph

line: advantage of this benefit someone must contact AXA Assistance for
label: paragraph

line: you as soon as possible.
label: paragraph

line: For simple out-patient treatment, you should pay the hospital/clinic
label: paragraph

line: yourself and claim back medical expenses from us on your return to
label: paragraph

line: the country of residence. Beware of requests for you to sign for
label: paragraph

line: excessive treatment or charges. If in doubt regarding any such
label: paragraph

line: requests, please call AXA Assistance for guidance.
label: paragraph

line: RECIPROCAL HEALTH AGREEMENTS
label: heading

line: EUROPEAN UNION (EU), EUROPEAN ECONOMIC AREA (EEA)
label: paragraph

line: AND SWITZERLAND
label: paragraph

line: Before travelling to a European Union (EU) country, the European
label: paragraph

line: Economic Area (EEA) or Switzerland, we recommend that you apply
label: paragraph

line: for a European Health Insurance Card (EHIC) via your local Post
label: paragraph

line: Office or online https://www.ehic.org.uk/Internet/home.do. This card
label: paragraph

line: entitles you to certain free or reduced cost health cover
label: paragraph

line: arrangements in the EU, EEA or Switzerland.
label: paragraph

line: A USTRALIA
label: paragraph

line: When you are travelling to Australia and you register for treatment
label: paragraph

line: under the national Medicare scheme, Medicare provides:
label: paragraph

line: free treatment as an in-patient or out-patient at a public hospital;
label: paragraph

line: subsidised medicines under the Pharmaceutical Benefits
label: paragraph

line: Scheme; and
label: paragraph

line: benefits for medical treatment provided by doctors through
label: paragraph

line: private surgeries and Government Health Centres (not hospitals).
label: paragraph

line: You must enrol at Medicare offices in Australia if you will be
label: paragraph

line: receiving treatment. If you receive treatment before you enrol,
label: paragraph

line: Medicare benefits can be backdated, if you are eligible. To be
label: paragraph

line: eligible you must be a resident of the United Kingdom and will need
label: paragraph

line: to show your passport with an appropriate visa. If you do not enrol
label: paragraph

line: at Medicare offices we may reject your claim or limit the amount we
label: paragraph

line: pay to you. If you need treatment which cannot be carried out under
label: paragraph

line: Medicare you MUST contact our 24 hours Emergency
label: paragraph

line: Service before seeking private treatment. If you do not do so, we
label: paragraph

line: may reject your claim or limit the amount we pay to you.
label: paragraph

line: F or more information you should contact: Health Insurance
label: paragraph

line: Commission, PO Box 1001, Tuggeranong, ACT 2901, Australia or
label: paragraph

line: visit their website at: www.hic.gov.au
label: paragraph

line: dispose of any damaged items as we may need to see them.
label: paragraph

line: You or your legal representatives must supply at your own
label: paragraph

line: expense all information, evidence, medical certificates, original
label: paragraph

line: invoices, receipts, reports, assistance that may be needed

label: paragraph

line: including details of other insurance policies that may cover the
label: paragraph

line: loss. We may refuse to reimburse you for any expenses for
label: paragraph

line: which you cannot provide receipts or bills. Please keep copies of
label: paragraph

line: all documents sent to us.
label: paragraph

line: You must not admit, deny, settle, reject, negotiate or make any
label: paragraph

line: arrangement for any claim without our permission.
label: paragraph

line: Tell us and provide full details in writing immediately if someone
label: paragraph

line: is holding you responsible for damage to their property or bodily
label: paragraph

line: injury to them. You must also immediately send us any writ or
label: paragraph

line: summons, letter of claim or other document.
label: paragraph

line: In the event of a claim and if we require it, you must agree to be
label: paragraph

line: examined by a medical practitioner of our choice, at our
label: paragraph

line: expense. In the event of your death we may also request and
label: paragraph

line: will pay for a post-mortem examination.
label: paragraph

line: If we provide transportation or settle your claim and as a result
label: paragraph

line: you have unused travel ticket(s) you must surrender those
label: paragraph

line: tickets to us. If you do not we will deduct the amount of those
label: paragraph

line: tickets from any amount paid to you.
label: paragraph

line: We have the right, if we choose, in your name but at our
label: paragraph

line: expense to:
label: paragraph

line: a) take over the defence or settlement of any claim;
label: paragraph

line: b) take legal action in your name to get compensation from
label: paragraph

line: anyone else for our own benefit or to get back from
label: paragraph

line: anyone else any payments that have already been made;
label: paragraph

line: c) take any action to get back any lost property or property
label: paragraph

line: believed to be lost.
label: paragraph

line: If you or anyone acting for you in any respect, attempts to gain
label: paragraph

line: funds, information or other assets by deception or any other
label: paragraph

line: illegal means, including deliberate misrepresentation or omission
label: paragraph

line: of facts in order to misrepresent the true situation, this policy
label: paragraph

line: shall become void. We may inform the police and you must
label: paragraph

line: repay to us any amount already received under the policy.
label: paragraph

line: If we pay any expense for which you are not covered, you must
label: paragraph

line: pay this back within one month of our asking.
label: paragraph

line: We will make every effort to apply the full range of services in all
label: paragraph

line: circumstances as shown in your Policy booklet. Remote
label: paragraph

line: geographical locations or unforeseeable adverse local conditions
label: paragraph

line: may prevent the normal standard of service being provided.
label: paragraph

line: We may at any time pay to you our full liability under the Policy
label: paragraph

line: after which no further payments will be made in any respect.

line: If at the time of any incident which results in a claim under this
label: paragraph

label: paragraph

line: Accident).

label: paragraph

line: GENERAL EXCLUSIONS
label: heading

line: These exclusions apply throughout your Benefit Schedule. We will
label: paragraph

line: not pay for claims arising directly or indirectly from:
label: paragraph

line: Any pre-existing medical conditions.
label: paragraph

line: War, invasion, acts of foreign enemies, hostilities or warlike
label: paragraph

line: operations (whether war be declared or not), civil war, rebellion,
label: paragraph

line: terrorism, revolution, insurrection, civil commotion assuming
label: paragraph

line: the proportions of or amounting to an uprising, military or
label: paragraph

line: usurped power but this exclusion shall not apply to losses under
label: paragraph

line: Section H – Emergency Medical and Other Expenses Abroad,
label: paragraph

line: Section I – Hospital Benefit and Section K – Travel Accident
label: paragraph

line: unless such losses are caused by nuclear, chemical or
label: paragraph

line: biological attack, or the disturbances were already taking place
label: paragraph

line: at the beginning of any trip.
label: paragraph

line: Ionising radiation or contamination by radioactivity from any
label: paragraph

line: nuclear fuel or from any nuclear waste, from combustion of
label: paragraph

line: nuclear fuel, the radioactive, toxic, explosive or other hazardous
label: paragraph

line: properties of any nuclear assembly or nuclear component of
label: paragraph

line: such assembly.
label: paragraph

line: Loss, destruction or damage directly occasioned by pressure
label: paragraph

line: waves caused by aircraft and other aerial devices travelling at
label: paragraph

line: sonic or supersonic speeds.
label: paragraph

line: Your participation in or practice of any sport or activity unless it
label: paragraph

label: paragraph

line: Your engagement in or practice of: manual work involving the
label: paragraph

line: use of dangerous equipment in connection with a profession
label: paragraph

line: business or trade, flying except as a fare paying passenger in a
label: paragraph

line: fully-licensed passenger-carrying aircraft, the use of motorised
label: paragraph

line: two or three wheeled vehicles unless a full driving licence issued
label: paragraph

line: in your country of residence is held permitting the use of such
label: paragraph

line: vehicles, professional entertaining, professional sports, racing
label: paragraph

line: (other than on foot), motor rallies and motor competitions, or any
label: paragraph

line: tests for speed or endurance.
label: paragraph

line: Any claim resulting from you attempting or committing suicide;
label: paragraph

line: deliberately injuring yourself; using any drug not prescribed by a
label: paragraph

line: registered medical practitioner, being addicted to any drugs, or
label: paragraph

line: abusing solvents, drugs, or alcohol, or being under the influence
label: paragraph

line: of drugs, solvents, or alcohol.
label: paragraph

line: Self exposure to needless peril (except in an attempt to save
label: paragraph

line: human life).
label: paragraph

line: Any claim resulting from your involvement in a fight except in
label: paragraph

line: self-defence.
label: paragraph

line: Your travel against any health requirements stipulated by the
label: paragraph

label: paragraph

line: provider.
label: paragraph

line: Your own unlawful action or any criminal proceedings against
label: paragraph

line: you.

label: paragraph

label: paragraph

label: paragraph

line: which would have been covered under such other Insurance, or
label: paragraph

label: paragraph

label: paragraph

line: Any other loss, damage or additional expense following on from
label: paragraph

label: paragraph

label: paragraph

line: preparing a claim, loss of earnings, loss or costs incurred arising

label: paragraph

line: or loss of enjoyment.

line: Operational duties as a member of the Armed Forces.

label: paragraph

line: government agency in the country of residence or the World
label: paragraph

line: which are officially under embargo by the United Nations.

line: Any costs you would have been required or been expected to

line: pay, if the event resulting in the claim had not happened.

line: Any circumstances you are aware of that could reasonably be

line: expected to give rise to a claim on this policy.

line: passport from a country other than the country of residence, we

label: paragraph

line: concerned.

label: paragraph

line: customs duties and regulations
label: paragraph

line: weather forecasts abroad.

line: specific languages spoken at the travel destination.

line: time zones and time differences.

line: SECTION B – TRAVEL ASSISTANCE
label: heading

line: WHAT IS COVERED
label: paragraph

line: During your trip we will:
label: paragraph

line: assist you with the procurement of a lawyer and/or interpreter and
label: paragraph

line: or the advance of any legal or interpreter’s fees if you are
label: paragraph

line: arrested or threatened with arrest while travelling, or are required
label: paragraph

line: to deal with any public authority.
label: paragraph

line: relay messages to your close relatives, business colleagues or
label: paragraph

line: friends in your country of residence.
label: paragraph

line: assist in locating your luggage lost by a common carrier and
label: paragraph

line: organise the dispatch of such luggage, if recovered, to your
label: paragraph

line: location outside of the country of residence. Costs of dispatch, if
label: paragraph

line: any, shall be borne by you without prejudice of your possible
label: paragraph

line: claim against the responsible and/or the travel agent.
label: paragraph

line: provide an advance of funds up to the amount shown in the
label: paragraph

line: Benefit Table, if your covered card is lost or stolen and there
label: paragraph

line: are no other means for you to obtain funds. All advances and
label: paragraph

line: delivery fees will be charged to your covered card account
label: paragraph

line: unless other accepted means of repayment to us are made in
label: paragraph

line: advance.
label: paragraph

line: provide you with necessary information and assist you in
label: paragraph

line: obtaining replacement travel documents such as passport, entry
label: paragraph

line: visa or airline tickets, from the appropriate local authority if the
label: paragraph

line: documents required for the return journey are lost or stolen. We
label: paragraph

line: will not pay the charges payable for issuing new documents.
label: paragraph

line: refer you to physicians, hospitals, clinics, ambulances, private
label: paragraph

line: duty nurses, dentists, dental clinics, services for the disabled,
label: paragraph

line: ophthalmologists, pharmacies, opticians and suppliers of contact
label: paragraph

line: lenses and medical aid equipment.
label: paragraph

line: replace essential prescription medication which has been lost or
label: paragraph

line: stolen, if it, or a local equivalent, is unavailable when you are
label: paragraph

line: outside the country of residence. We will bear the costs for
label: paragraph

line: dispatch, but all costs of obtaining the medicine will be borne by
label: paragraph

line: you. The transportation of medicine remains subject to the
label: paragraph

line: regulations imposed by airline companies or any other
label: paragraph

line: transportation company, as well as local and/or international law.
label: paragraph

line: in the case of an illness or bodily injury affecting your close
label: paragraph

line: relative residing in the country of residence, AXA Assistance
label: paragraph

line: will monitor their condition and keep you informed.
label: paragraph
